intro: Fimbristylis caloptera, commonly known as the narrowleaf flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered spikelets that bear tiny flowers, typically blooming during the wet season. Fimbristylis caloptera thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in marshy areas, swamps, or along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting a variety of wildlife.
